info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 4:57PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BERNALILLO COUNTY THROUGH 515 PM MDT... At 456 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over southeastern Albuquerque, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southern Albuquerque, Isleta Pueblo and South Valley. This includes Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 210 and 222. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
